title: Classic TV Cowboys
description: Western TV heroes and their shows

questions.question: Which actor played Marshal Matt Dillon on 'Gunsmoke,' the longest-running primetime live-action series in TV history?
On 'Bonanza,' what was the name of the Cartwright family's massive ranch near Virginia City, Nevada?
Which Western hero, played by Clayton Moore, wore a mask and rode a white horse named Silver?
What was the name of the Lone Ranger's faithful Native American companion?
Which singing cowboy, known for his Christmas classic 'Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer,' also had his own TV show?
On 'Bonanza,' which actor played the family patriarch Ben Cartwright?
Which TV Western featured a bounty hunter named Josh Randall who carried a sawed-off Winchester rifle called 'Mare's Leg'?
Chuck Connors starred as Lucas McCain, a widowed rancher with a rapid-fire Winchester, on which TV Western?
Which suave TV cowboy, played by Richard Boone, carried a business card reading 'Have Gun Will Travel'?
Roy Rogers was known as the 'King of the Cowboys.' What was the name of his famous palomino horse?
Which young actor, who later starred in 'Little House on the Prairie,' played Little Joe Cartwright on 'Bonanza'?
On 'Gunsmoke,' what was the name of the saloon in Dodge City where much of the action took place?
Which TV Western starred James Garner as a charming, card-playing cowboy who preferred to talk his way out of trouble?
William Boyd played which cowboy character, dressed in black, who was one of the first TV Western stars in the late 1940s?
A young Clint Eastwood got his big break playing Rowdy Yates on which TV Western about a cattle drive?
